Guide to the Nineteenth Century Administrative Records,
1830 - 1929

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Nineteenth Century Administrative Records, 1830 - 1929
titlepage.publisher:
Special Collections & Archives
Wesleyan University
Middletown, CT, USA

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult Special Collections & Archives staff.
did.abstract: Wesleyan University was founded in 1831 in Middletown, Conn.

The Nineteenth Century Administrative Records Collection consists of the original charter for Wesleyan University, early Trustee, University Secretary, and faculty records, and financial records related to donors, students, and the university itself. The financial items consist of correspondence, statements, accounts, bills, receipts, inventories, tuition, and housing information. There is also information about student admittance, attendence, absences, and demerits.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Wesleyan University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Nineteenth Century Administrative Records, Collection #1000-97, Special Collections & Archives, Wesleyan University, Middletown, CT, USA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisitions Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was assembled through transfers from various University departments prior to 1982.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Elizabeth Swaim, University Archives Staff, 1982

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Wesleyan University was founded in 1831 in Middletown, Conn. Originally a small Methodist institution for men, with a student body of 48, it had by the end of the 19th century admitted both male and female students for a population of 339.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Nineteenth Century Administrative Records Collection consists of the original charter for Wesleyan University, early Trustee, University Secretary, and faculty records, and financial records related to donors, students, and the university itself. The financial items consist of correspondence, statements, accounts, bills, receipts, inventories, tuition, and housing information. There is also information about student admittance, attendence, absences, and demerits.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into the following series: General Records; Financial Records: General; Financial Records: Donors; Student Records: Financial and General; Alumni and Visitor Records, and Oversize.

controlaccess.head: Online Catalog Headings
controlaccess.p: These and related materials may be found under the following headings in online catalogs.
controlaccess.corpname: Wesleyan University (Middletown, Conn.). Board of Trustees.

otherfindaid.head: Other Guides to this Collection
otherfindaid.p: There is an older, paper finding aid also available for this collection.

did.unittitle: An Act to incorporate the Wesleyan University, 1831

scopecontent.p: Note: Charter of University. 4 leaves. On verso of last leaf: Wesleyan University: Act of incorporation. Registered draft by Mr. Stanley. Original is in some places illegible. Accompanied by typed transcript.

did.unittitle: Charter of the Wesleyan University, 1859, and Laws and rules of the Joint Board of Trustees and Visitors

scopecontent.p: Note: 16 leaves. Apparently a printer's copy for the 1859 (first) printing. The laws and rules were adopted by the Joint Board, 21 June 1859. The first two and last three leaves are in the handwriting of President Cummings.

did.unittitle: Board of Trustees: Extracts from minutes, 1830-1857
Board of Trustees: Committee reports, correspondence, financial exhibit, etc., 1871-1917
Joint Board of Trustees and Visitors, 1830-1870
List of trustees and visitors, resolutions passed, etc., 1836-1859
Prudential Committee: Annual reports to the Joint Board of Trustees and Visitors, 1839-1870
Faculty: extracts from minutes, resolutions, etc., 1840-1866
Correspondence of Jacob Huber, Secretary for the Wesleyan University, October 1837-July 1842

scopecontent.p: Note: Records of outgoing correspondence and lists of visitors from various conferences.
Note: Correspondence regarding honorary degrees; letters to Augustus W. Smith regarding nominations of visitors and members of the examining committees by the Methodist Conferences.

Note: One volume containing: sundry journal entries, 1830-1831; sundry ledger accounts, 1839-1843; lists of students entering Wesleyan University between 1831/32 and 1844/45; and sundry accounts, July 1871-June 7, 1877.
Note: Receipts and expenditures, loans due by Wesleyan University.

did.unittitle: Financial statement of the first five years at Wesleyan, 1831-1836
Financial exhibits and statements, including tuition exhibits, 1836-1877

scopecontent.p: Note: Check stubs, empty checks; also laid in are scratch sheets and a letter regarding pipes.
Note: Money owed to the university, cancellation of stock.

did.unittitle: Volume containing list of materials belonging to the Wesleyan University Laboratory, 1835-1837
Volume containing list of apparatus belonging to the Wesleyan University Laboratory, 1835-1837

scopecontent.p: Note: Expenditures and receipts. Also laid in are various separate financial exhibits.

did.unittitle: Treasurer's notes on the Wesleyan University, 1837-1877
Cancelled notes and miscellaneous bills and receipts, 1844-1851, 1877

scopecontent.p: Note: Check stubs, numbered 1-50, for bills paid to various people for supplies.

did.unittitle: Notes and bills payable and receivable, 1855-1875
Volume containing list of original subscribers and sums promised for support of the Wesleyan University, 1830-1833
Correspondence regarding subscriptions to Wesleyan, including inability to pay, 1835-1852
Subscription book for endowment of the Wesleyan University, 1839-1848
Volume with list of subscribers to a $20,000 endowment fund, 1836
Volume of Fisk professorship fund and centenary subscriptions at the Wesleyan University, circa 1841-1842

scopecontent.p: Note: List of subscribers; in back pocket: Statistics of the church at Wesleyan University; miscellaneous regarding Centenary subscription

did.unittitle: Book of accounts of monies received for the Wesleyan University within the bounds of the New Hamshire [sic] conference and elsewhere, 1844-1854

scopecontent.p: Note: 3 volumes with records of subscribers to the $100,000 permanent endowment fund.

did.unittitle: Correspondence and agreements regarding permanent endowment fund, 1847-1855
Volume of donations to Wesleyan University, 1858-1862

scopecontent.p: Note: List of donors and the amounts paid to Wesleyan; also a list of bonds owned by the school at this time.
Note: Subscribers agree to pay for five successive years the sums attached to their names . . . for the purpose of endowing new professorships and for other essential improvements.

did.unittitle: Volume of minutes of meetings of the Ladies Centenary Association, June 5, 1866-July 23, 1867

scopecontent.p: Note: The Ladies Centenary Association for the Wesleyan University raised funds for the erection of the Memorial Chapel.

did.unittitle: 1 volume with list of subscribers and amounts subscribed for the erection of the Wesleyan University Memorial Chapel, July 19, 1866

scopecontent.p: Note: Appeals to the State of Connecticut, to the Annual Conferences of the Methodist Episcopal Church; appeal for the Centum Millia fund, for serial subscriptions; for Memorial Chapel; general appeals; and appeals via the alumni regarding support of athletics.
Note: Scholarships include Permanent or Perpetual, Clergyman's or Ministerial, 10 percent stck, 15- and 50-year, Seney, etc.

did.unittitle: Expired certificates for use of scholarship, 1833-1847

scopecontent.p: Note: Appeals made by the committee and correspondence regarding donations.
See also Records of Attendence and Boarding Hall Cash Book in Oversize series.

did.unittitle: 1 volume of parents' and guardians' accounts with Wesleyan University for the expenses of students, 1830-1840

scopecontent.p: Note: Parent's or guardian's name at top of page with lists of expenses during stay at Wesleyan.

did.unittitle: 3 volumes of tuition books and bills, 1831-1835

scopecontent.p: Note: Volumes for 1831-1833, 1833-1834, and 1834-1835. Includes lists of students and amount of tuition by term.
Note: Lists of students and amount of tuition by term.
Note: Individual bills and lists of students and amount of tuition by term.
Note: Volume 1 is Treasurer's book for the Boarding Association, 1833-1835. Volumes 2-6 are Board books, 1833-1844.
Note: Volume 7 is an Inventory of boarding hall, 1834-1844. Volumes 8-9 contain a running expense account, 1834-1844.
Note: Statement by term on expenses, property of boarding house.

did.unittitle: Committee report on boarding hall arrangements recommending appointment of a steward, January 24, 1834, signed W. Fisk.

scopecontent.p: Note: Number of students by term, scholarships, room rents, stove rents, etc.
Note: Lists of occupants, repairs needed in college rooms.

did.unittitle: Recommendations of students for admission to Wesleyan, 1850-1857

scopecontent.p: Note: Lists of students' names, ages, courses of study, residences, names of parents or guardians and their occupations, and places of preparation.
Note: Alphabetical list of preparatory and high schools and number of students from each; list of schools with students' names, manner of admission, and grades (first half year).

did.unittitle: Reports of the Examining Committee of the Wesleyan University, 1833-1844

scopecontent.p: Note: Name of department, list of students who passed or were deficient, with comments by committee interspersed. Includes report of the first outside examining committee, recommending the first group of Wesleyan seniors for the B.A. degree.
Note: Divided by class, list of students; divided into weeks; lists of numbers and alphabet letters (meaning uncertain); title page says Weekly Exercises.

did.unittitle: Record of standing, class of 1860 (1 volume)

scopecontent.p: Note: By student and subject.
Note: By class, by students--exceptions, admonitions, not examined, not passed in various courses.
Note: Includes information on scholarships.

did.unittitle: Demerits, dismissals, and suspensions of students, 1874-1881 (1 volume)

scopecontent.p: Note: List of student names, number of demerits, dates.

did.unittitle: Demerit record, spring and fall 1875 (1 volume)

scopecontent.p: Note: Pieces of paper pasted in, includes chapel roll by classes, W.N. Rice classes, various courses.
Note: Pieces of paper pasted in, includes chapel roll by classes, W.N. Rice classes, various courses.
Note: Pieces of paper pasted in, includes chapel roll by classes, W.N. Rice classes, various courses.

did.unittitle: Excuses and demerits, class of 1884, January-June (2 volumes)

scopecontent.p: Note: Arranged chronologically: name, what missed, excuse.
See also Visitor's Register in Oversize series.

did.unittitle: Record of Alumni and Visitors, 1852-1854 (1 volume)
Alumni register, June 1893-June 1922 (1 volume and 1 folder)
Alumni Association, minutes of meetings, 1836-1916 (1 volume)
